items.description:
It's the weekend and that means it's time to relax and enjoy another edition of Weekly Xamarin.

Xamarin.Forms 5.0 is getting closer and the Xamarin Community Toolkit is getting some great updates. We are mid way through Hacktober, but there is still time to help contribute to these projects.

Have a great weekend everyone.

♥

Kym
items.description_markdown:
It's the weekend and that means it's time to relax and enjoy another edition of Weekly Xamarin. 

Xamarin.Forms 5.0 is getting closer and the Xamarin Community Toolkit is getting some great updates.  We are mid way through Hacktober, but there is  still time to help contribute to these projects.

Have a great weekend everyone.

♥

Kym

items.title: Improving our design system through Dark Mode
items.description:
Etsy recently launched Dark Mode in our iOS and Android buyer apps. Since Dark Mode was introduced system-wide last year in iOS 13 and Android 10, it has quickly become a highly requested feature by our users and an industry standard.

Improving our design system through Dark Mode by Stephanie Sharp
items.description_markdown:
Etsy recently launched Dark Mode in our iOS and Android buyer apps. Since Dark Mode was introduced system-wide last year in iOS 13 and Android 10, it has quickly become a highly requested feature by our users and an industry standard.

[**Improving our design system through Dark Mode**](https://codeascraft.com/2020/10/21/improving-our-design-system-through-dark-mode/) by [Stephanie Sharp](https://codeascraft.com/author/ssharp/)

embedded_links.title: **Improving our design system through Dark Mode**

items.title: Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility
items.description:
Android 11 introduced several exciting updates for developers to integrate into their app experience including new device and media controls, enhanced support for foldables, and a lot more. In addition to new features there are also several privacy enhancements that developers need to integrate into their application when upgraded and re-targeting to Android 11.

Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
Android 11 introduced several exciting updates for developers to integrate into their app experience including new device and media controls, enhanced support for foldables, and a lot more. In addition to new features there are also several privacy enhancements that developers need to integrate into their application when upgraded and re-targeting to Android 11.

[**Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/android-11-package-visibility/) by [James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jamesmontemagno/)

embedded_links.title: **Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility**

items.title: iPhone 12 Screen Sizes
items.description:
Screen size fragmentation used to only be a problem for Android developers. Now Apple has released the same feature. ;-) This is a useful article if you want your app to adapt to that new shiny apple hardware.

How iOS Apps Adapt to the various iPhone 12 Screen Sizes by Geoff Hackworth
items.description_markdown:
Screen size fragmentation used to only be a problem for Android developers. Now Apple has released the same feature. ;-)  This is a useful article if you want your app to adapt to that new shiny apple hardware.

[**How iOS Apps Adapt to the various iPhone 12 Screen Sizes**](https://hacknicity.medium.com/how-ios-apps-adapt-to-the-various-iphone-12-screen-sizes-e45c021e1b8b) by [Geoff Hackworth](https://hacknicity.medium.com/@hacknicity)

embedded_links.title: **How iOS Apps Adapt to the various iPhone 12 Screen Sizes**

items.title: Background Location Updates in iOS
items.description:
In this article, Rendy will show you how to get background time-based location updates by using a DispatchSourceTimer. It is the lowest level background timer API that gives you more control over the time interval and provides adjustments parameters for energy efficiency.

Battery efficient background time-based location updates on iOS by Rendy Del Rosario
items.description_markdown:
In this article, Rendy will show you how to get background time-based location updates by using a DispatchSourceTimer. It is the lowest level background timer API that gives you more control over the time interval and provides adjustments parameters for energy efficiency.

[**Battery efficient background time-based location updates on iOS**](https://www.xamboy.com/2020/10/19/battery-efficient-background-time-based-location-updates-on-ios/) by [Rendy Del Rosario](https://twitter.com/rdelrosario)

embedded_links.title: **Battery efficient background time-based location updates on iOS**

items.title: Bringing .NET extensions to Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
This blog post will show you a way of integrating configuration, dependency injection, logging and localization of the .NET extensions stack into your Xamarin.Forms application.

Bringing .NET extensions to Xamarin.Forms by Christopher Dresel
items.description_markdown:
This blog post will show you a way of integrating configuration, dependency injection, logging and localization of the .NET extensions stack into your Xamarin.Forms application.

[**Bringing .NET extensions to Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.spatial-focus.net/blog/bringing-net-extensions-to-xamarin-forms) by [Christopher Dresel](https://www.spatial-focus.net/blog/author/e215da98-13e9-4cba-bcc8-b3b7d092c6f4)

items.title: Adding Shortcuts with Xamarin Essentials
items.description:
Leomaris shows how to use a new feature in Xamarin Essentials to add shortcuts for your app on the home-screen.

Adding Shortcuts with Xamarin Essentials by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Leomaris shows how to use a new feature in Xamarin Essentials to add shortcuts for your app on the home-screen.

[**Adding Shortcuts with Xamarin Essentials**](https://askxammy.com/adding-shortcuts-with-xamarin-essentials/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://askxammy.com/author/leoreyes/)

items.title: Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates
items.description:
Glenn Versweyveld digs into Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates in Xamarin.Forms to be able to show a different view of some data by swapping the style of a ContentView while using Control Template.

Xamarin Forms – Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates by Glenn Versweyveld
items.description_markdown:
Glenn Versweyveld digs into Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates in Xamarin.Forms to be able to show a different view of some data by swapping the style of a ContentView while using Control Template.

[**Xamarin Forms – Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates**](https://depblog.weblogs.us/2020/10/19/xamarin-forms-custom-visual-state-triggers-and-control-templates/) by [Glenn Versweyveld](https://twitter.com/depechie)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin Forms – Custom Visual State triggers and Control Templates**

items.title: Adding Dark Theme Support for Xamarin Forms Shell
items.description:
Xamarin Forms has had support for Dark Mode for a while now. However, how it is supported has changed. This blog post digs in a little more.

Adding Dark Theme Support for Xamarin Forms Shell by Mitchel Sellers
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin Forms has had support for Dark Mode for a while now. However, how it is supported has changed.  This blog post digs in a little more.

[**Adding Dark Theme Support for Xamarin Forms Shell**](https://mitchelsellers.com/blog/article/adding-dark-theme-support-for-xamarin-forms-shell) by [Mitchel Sellers](https://twitter.com/mitchelsellers)

embedded_links.title: **Adding Dark Theme Support for Xamarin Forms Shell**

items.title: OTP Auto-Fill Entry for iOS
items.description:
Gerald shows how you can implement One Time Password (OTP) support to your Xamarin.Forms iOS Apps.

OTP Auto-Fill Entry for iOS with Xamarin.Forms by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Gerald shows how you can implement One Time Password (OTP) support to your Xamarin.Forms iOS Apps.

[**OTP Auto-Fill Entry for iOS with Xamarin.Forms**](https://blog.verslu.is/xamarin/xamarin-forms-xamarin/otp-auto-fill-entry-for-ios-with-xamarin-forms/) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **OTP Auto-Fill Entry for iOS with Xamarin.Forms**

items.title: In-app reviews for your Android apps
items.description:
In Android you can now enable users to provide in-app reviews. Who knew? Sameer did and in this post he shows how with just a few lines of code you can bring this feature to your apps.

In-app reviews for your Android apps by Saamer Mansoor
items.description_markdown:
In Android you can now enable users to provide in-app reviews.  Who knew? Sameer did and in this post he shows how  with just a few lines of code you can bring this feature to your apps.

[**In-app reviews for your Android apps**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/android-in-app-reviews/) by [Saamer Mansoor](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/saamermansoor/)

items.title: Xamarin.Forms 5 Is Here!
items.description:
This week, James is joined by David Ortinau, Xamarin Principal Program Manager, who is here to talk about all of the goodies that are available in the brand new release Xamarin.Forms 5.0! He walks us through what is in, what is out, and what are the major themes of the release.

Xamarin.Forms 5 Is Here! by The Xamarin Show
items.description_markdown:
This week, James is joined by David Ortinau, Xamarin Principal Program Manager, who is here to talk about all of the goodies that are available in the brand new release Xamarin.Forms 5.0! He walks us through what is in, what is out, and what are the major themes of the release.

[**Xamarin.Forms 5 Is Here!**](https://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/XamarinShow/XamarinForms-5-Is-Here) by [The Xamarin Show](https://channel9.msdn.com/shows/xamarinshow)

items.title: DevTalk 48: Moving from Xamarin.iOS to Swift. With Damian Mehers
items.description:
On this episode of DevTalk I speak to Damian Mehers about applying your Xamarin.iOS knowledge using Apple’s Swift.

48: Moving from Xamarin.iOS to Swift. With Damian Mehers by Kerry Lothrop
items.description_markdown:

items.title: The Xamarin Podcast: Seeing AI
items.description:
Seeing AI is an app for iOS that narrates the world around you. And it's built with Xamarin and Azure. In this episode of the Xamarin Podcast, Matt talks to the folks behind Seeing AI. The history of the app, how it was built, and the challenges and successes encountered along the way.

Seeing AI by The Xamarin Podcast
items.description_markdown:
Seeing AI is an app for iOS that narrates the world around you. And it's built with Xamarin and Azure. In this episode of the Xamarin Podcast, Matt talks to the folks behind Seeing AI. The history of the app, how it was built, and the challenges and successes encountered along the way.

[**Seeing AI**](https://www.xamarinpodcast.com/80) by [The Xamarin Podcast](https://twitter.com/XamarinPodcast)
